item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1716; 10:47PM; 5728 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IHgzxu; #HydePark; Firefighters mounted a coordinated attack between rooftop ventilation and interior fire attack, on the home that contained excessive storage conditions inside. All occupants from the structure safely escaped. Ultimately, it took 20 firefighters 16 minutes to extinguish the flames, without injury. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 T66; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1716; 10:31PM; 5728 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IHgzxu; #HydePark; One-story single-family home with moderate smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 T66; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Update Train vs Vehicle - Physical Rescue 02/20/2023 INC#1364

item.description: Update Train vs Vehicle - Physical Rescue; INC#1364; 07:10PM; 1629 E 24th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KiFuWn; #CentralAlameda; A total of 5 people were in the vehicle that was struck by a Metro A (Blue) line train. Two were deceased on scene. Three have been transported to local hospitals in fair-to-moderate condition. Unknown ages/genders/circumstances. Approximately 125 passengers have now exited the train, without medical complaint. Two train operators have also disembarked. One is being evaluated as a precaution.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E17 E21 E221 E288 E88 EM1 EM11 EM13 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA21 RA25 RA801 RA9 SQ21 T21 T88 UR88; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Train vs Vehicle - Physical Rescue 02/20/2023 INC#1364

item.description: Train vs Vehicle - Physical Rescue; INC#1364; 06:16PM; 1629 E 24th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KiFuWn; #CentralAlameda; Firefighters found a vehicle that was struck by a train, with two patients trapped inside. Both patients were quickly extricated, but sadly, one was beyond medical help. The other will be transported in grave condition. A third patient is being assessed on scene for seemingly-minor injuries. Crews searched the train for additional injuries, but found no complaints from passengers. Unknown ages/genders/circumstances/affiliations.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E17 E21 E221 E288 E88 EM1 HR3 RA10 RA21 SQ21 T21 T88 UR88; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#1134; 03:50PM; 20607 Hillside Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IE1dtm; #PacificPalisades; Firefighters located an adult male patient who had sustained a shoulder injury while riding a dirt bike in a remote area. LAFD Air Ops has now hoisted the patient and transported to a local hospital. Nothing further.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP23 E23 E269 H2 H3 HA2 HA3 RA23 RH114 T69; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Train vs Pedestrian; INC#0751; 12:00PM; 1131 E Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SbFmg5; #DowntownLA; One patient was struck by a train (main impact to leg only) and transported by LAFD firefighter-paramedics in moderate condition. Nothing further.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E14 E9 EM1 HR3 RA10 T9 UR88; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0647; 10:55AM; 9225 Canter Ln; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SdKro2; #ShadowHills; Firefighters located an approximately 70-year-old female on a hiking trail with an ankle injury, unable to make it back to her vehicle. LAFD Air Operations lowered a flight paramedic down to assist her and prepare for hoist. The patient was hoisted and transported by air to a local hospital. No additional details.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC14 E289 E298 E77 E98 H2 H3 HA2 HA3 RA78 RA87 RH114 T89 T98; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/20/2023 INC#0473

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0473; 09:16AM; 963 W 43rd Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41b2QWz; #VermontSquare; Firefighters found a large single-family home with fire showing and heavy pressurized smoke coming from the vents. Crews ascended ladders to ventilate the roof, as companies made entry with hose lines to fight the fire from the interior. It took 57 firefighters 21 minutes to extinguish the flames. There were 7 civilian patients found. Two were transported in critical condition by firefighter-paramedics, while the other 5 declined transport after being evaluated on scene. One firefighter was transported in fair condition for minor smoke inhalation. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E15 E21 E215 E221 E229 E233 E33 E46 E57 E66 EM1 EM11 EM13 PH1 RA10 RA14 RA17 RA246 RA25 RA33 RA46 RA64 RA66 RA9 RA94 SQ21 T15 T21 T29 T33; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0473; 08:55AM; 4311 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3lUCCYc; #VermontSquare; One-story single-family home with heavy fire showing. Reports of multiple patients. Offensive mode.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E215 E233 E46 E57 E66 RA246 RA46 SQ21 T15 T33; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0296; 06:48AM; 820 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z620sE; #Westlake; Firefighters arrived to find an out building on fire, spreading to a two-story living space (guest house? accessory dwelling unit?). 54 Firefighters split their efforts to extinguish both structures in 24 minutes. Firefighters found one occupant in the living quarters and evacuated him. As a precaution, firefighter-paramedics did a full assessment and found him to be in good condition, with no need for treatment or transport. No injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E203 E209 E210 E211 E215 E220 E229 E29 E89 E9 EA1 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA803 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T20 T29 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange
